p: Figure 7 shows that the TPC EE% varied from 7.74% ± 0.69% to 75.59% ± 0.36% and it was the highest when the wall material contained 30% of sodium caseinate (SCAS30) and the lowest when the wall material contained 20% of beta-cyclodextrin (BCYC20). The TFC EE (%) increases when the wall material concentrations are in the range of 10% > 20% > 30% (using sodium caseinate (SCAS) and skim milk (SKIM)). The TFC EE (%) decreases when the concentration of wall material increases (for example, using maltodextrin (MD), gum arabic (GUM), and resistant-maltodextrin (RMD)) ( Figure 7).
